[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Epoch Boundary] During epoch transitions when state is being resharded, can timing-dependent errors (IoError, RecvError) cause some validators to see old epoch state while others see new epoch, breaking validator set updates? (Critical)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Transaction Ordering] If TooManyRequested error triggers during parallel transaction execution, does error recovery ensure transaction order remains deterministic across validators or could it cause nonce sequence violations? (High)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Snapshot Consistency] Can RocksDbIncompleteResult errors during snapshot creation result in partially committed state snapshots that, when restored, produce different state roots than original chain? (Critical)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [State Synchronization] During fast sync, if NotFound errors occur for recent state items, does error handling properly trigger full state sync vs incorrectly assuming data will arrive later, causing permanent desync? (Critical)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Gas Exhaustion] Can BcsError during transaction deserialization be exploited to cause repeated retries that consume gas without making progress, enabling DoS against transaction execution? (High)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Rollback Safety] If Other error occurs during state rollback after failed transaction, does error handling ensure atomicity or could partial rollback leave database in inconsistent state? (Critical)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Byzantine Fault Detection] Do the error types defined in this file provide sufficient granularity for consensus to distinguish between crash faults (retryable) and Byzantine faults (requires validator ejection)? (High)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Merkle Tree Corruption] If cryptographic hash mismatch occurs in merkle tree, which error type is returned, and does error handling trigger emergency halt vs attempting recovery that could propagate corruption? (Critical)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Concurrent Access] Can race conditions in concurrent storage operations cause non-deterministic error types (IoError vs RecvError vs RocksDbIncompleteResult) that break deterministic execution? (High)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [API Attack Surface] Do storage errors propagated to REST API expose enough information for attackers to fingerprint validator storage state and plan targeted attacks on specific state items? (Medium)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Error String Injection] Can error messages stored in String fields (lines 14, 22-35) be crafted by attacker to inject control characters or ANSI codes that corrupt validator logs and hide malicious activity? (Low)

[File: storage/storage-interface/src/errors.rs] [Error Handling] [Memory Exhaustion] If errors contain large String messages (e.g., RocksDbIncompleteResult with huge key dump), can repeated error creation during attack exhaust validator memory? (Medium)
